questions.question_text: In which stage of the ServiceNow Implementation Methodology (SIM) is the purpose to define processes and requirements for engagement and finalize delivery plan and user stories?

discussion.content: Prepare seems like a mistype and plan is the correct answer here, so i will go with D

As per the ServiceNow Implementation Methodology data sheet: 
"Prepare: Hold workshops to understand process and platform needs. Finalize 
engagement timeline and refine configuration requirements (stories)."
Answer is D - Prepare
https://blogs.servicenow.com/content/dam/servicenow-assets/public/en-us/doc-type/data-sheet/ds-sim.pdf
It should be Plan :)

Selected Answer: D
Not certain, but I think D is correct. From documentation: 

Prepare: Hold workshops to understand process and platform needs. Finalize engagement timeline and refine configuration requirements (stories).
Right answer is E, initiate: https://www.servicenow.com/success/now-value/nowcreate.html

comments.content: Looking at your own link it seems to correlate with 'Plan', which as others have suggested is probably meant to be there in place of 'Prepare'

discussion.content: Prepare is not a stage, i would say Plan!

Selected Answer: A
SAM Professional Fundamentals On Demand Course, Practical Management, Practical Management Overview, Software Suites:
Suites can identify inference criteria. An inference percent defines what percent of the suite must be installed to be recognized as a suite. This is only used if the suite parent does not exist on the device.

Selected Answer: A
"d. Suites can identify inference criteria. 
i. An inference percent defines what percent of the suite must be installed to be recognized as a suite. 
ii. This is only used if the suite parent does not exist on the device.
"

Selected Answer: A
Explanation: https://www.servicenow.com/community/sam-blog/handling-software-suites-on-servicenow-sam/ba-p/2284642

questions.question_text: What is used to determine if installations are a part of a suite only when the suite parent is not discovered on a device?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: CD
Does anyone have any proof that A is correct? When scanning the documentation (https://docs.servicenow.com/bundle/vancouver-servicenow-platform/page/product/orchestration/concept/c_SCCMSoftwareRevocation.html) it suggests that removal is handled via Workflow Activities, not some form of scheduled job. 

I'm leaning towards D, as no Orchestration license is required for CSD if SAM is already installed. I'm making an assumption that it is installed as part of this question as this is what the exam is on.

Selected Answer: AC
Okay I want to give a new answer because D is not true, Orchestration plugin is needed for reclamation.

It's AC:
https://docs.servicenow.com/bundle/vancouver-servicenow-platform/page/product/orchestration/concept/c_ClientSoftwareDistribution.html

comments.content:
Request client software distribution

Client software distribution requires the Orchestration - Client Software Distribution plugin (com.snc.orchestration.client_sf_distribution), which is available by request with a subscription to Orchestration.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: CD
https://docs.servicenow.com/bundle/vancouver-servicenow-platform/page/product/orchestration/concept/c_ClientSoftwareDistribution.html

The Client Software Distribution (CSD) application allows administrators to distribute software from the service catalog using third-party management systems.

CSD allows an administrator to create all the records necessary to deploy software from service catalog requests, including software models and catalog items. You can use the CSD application to automate the deployment and revocation of software from an SCCM host using the custom SCCM activity pack. You can define lease periods for software distributed from the Service Catalog and allow lease extensions in some cases, pending approvals. Deployment is accomplished using Orchestration activities and workflows.

There is also a picture there that shows Configuration as the first step.

Selected Answer: AC
can't be D, as there is separate subscription needed for distribution (orchestration)

Selected Answer: CD
The diagram shows "Configuration" as stage 1 = C. 
" You can use the CSD application to automate the deployment and revocation of software from an SCCM host using the custom SCCM activity pack." = D

Sources: CSD - https://docs.servicenow.com/bundle/rome-servicenow-platform/page/product/orchestration/concept/c_ClientSoftwareDistribution.html

SCCM Activity Pack outlining the Orchestration functions without the need for a separate license: https://docs.servicenow.com/bundle/rome-servicenow-platform/page/administer/orchestration-activities/concept/c_SCCMActivityPack.html

The full CSD product allows administrators to distribute, manage, and revoke software/ reclaim license automation, only revocation/reclamation capability is entitled as part of SAM. Full use of CSD product requires the Orchestration - Clien Software Distribution.
Which means you cannot distribute without Orchestration license as its said in asnwer D.

comments.content: This is where I have a problem with the question when looking at the other comments. Surely if the course/exam is centered around SAM, then there is no requirement to purchase a license for Orchestration as you will already have it as part of SAM. This is why I was leaning towards D being correct.

discussion.content: While SAM relies on Orchestration to perform software reclamation, the actual functionality is included in the SAM Professional license (i.e., the revocation/reclamation capability is entitled as part of SAM Pro). You do not need to own/purchase Orchestration separately in order to revoke software/reclaim license rights using SAM Pro.
D is not correct, I believe correct answer is A & C

choices.A: Removes software daily utilizing a scheduled job.
choices.B: ServiceNow does not have Client Software Distribution.
choices.C: The first stage in the CSD process flow is configuration.
choices.D: CSD can automatically distribute and reclaim software without a license for Orchestration.

questions.question_text: Which statements are true in regards to ServiceNowâ€™s Client Software Distribution (CSD) functionality? (Choose two.)
Which of the following SAM roles has permission to grant a user the script writing capability?

discussion.content: Course PDF Page 34, sam_developer role has permission to grant a user script writing capabilities

Selected Answer: C
Even SN says so in the try-out questions

Selected Answer: C
C, sam_developer from Document
> Software Asset Management developer [sam_developer]
> Writes scripts on the platform, comparable to the script-writing privileges granted to a sys_admin. Users with this role must be trained ServiceNow administrators.

Selected Answer: C
sam-developer contains the sam_admin role

Correct answer is C
Page 29 of study guide:
sam_developer - has permissions to grant a user script writing capabilities on ServiceNow platform, comparable to the script writing privileges granted to the sys_admin role.

Selected Answer: B
B, SAM admin.
It is the role that grant the developer role.
